logiclayer

Class UserLogicImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • logiclayer.UserLogicImpl

  • public class UserLogicImpl
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the controller class for all the functionalities of users. It directly interacts with the Servlet and user persistent layer classes.
    Author:
    Connor Kirk

      int getIdFromUsername(java.lang.String username)
      This method takes a string parameter that represents a username.
      User getSingleUser(int id)
      This method calls the UserPersistImpl class to gather a ResultSet containing an entry of the user with the id given as a parameter.
      java.util.ArrayList<User> getUsers()
      This method calls the UserPersistImpl class to gather a ResultSet of all users in the database.

      This method takes a string as a parameter, hashes it using MD5, and returns the hashed result.

      boolean validate(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      This method takes an input username and password, hashes the password, and calls the persist layer to return true if the username and hashed password exist as an entry in the users table; false otherwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserLogicImpl

        public UserLogicImpl()
        Default constructor. Creates a new object of UserPersistImpl.

    • Method Detail

      • hash

        private java.lang.String hash(java.lang.String original)
                       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        This method takes a string as a parameter, hashes it using MD5, and returns the hashed result.
        Parameters:
        original - The string to hash.
        Returns:
        MD5 hash of the string.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Only thrown if MD5 does not exist in the MessageDigest.

      • register

        public void register(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     java.lang.String firstName,
                     java.lang.String lastName,
                     java.lang.String phone,
                     java.lang.String email)
        This method takes user information, calls hash to encrypt the password, and calls the persist layer to create a new entry in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user.
        password - The password of the user.
        firstName - The first name of the user.
        lastName - The last name of the user.
        email - The email of the user.
        phone - The phone number of the user.

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String password)
        This method takes an input username and password, hashes the password, and calls the persist layer to return true if the username and hashed password exist as an entry in the users table; false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user to validate.
        password - The password of the user to validate.
        Returns:
        True if username and password match; false otherwise.

      • getUsers

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> getUsers()
        This method calls the UserPersistImpl class to gather a ResultSet of all users in the database. It then processes the ResultSet into a list of User objects.
        Returns:
        A list of User objects.

      • getSingleUser

        public User getSingleUser(int id)
        This method calls the UserPersistImpl class to gather a ResultSet containing an entry of the user with the id given as a parameter. It then processes the ResultSet into a single User object.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the User to get.
        Returns:
        The corresponding User object.

      • getIdFromUsername

        public int getIdFromUsername(java.lang.String username)
        This method takes a string parameter that represents a username. It then calls the UserPersistImpl object to get the entry in the users table containing the corresponding username. Then it will return the corresponding id.
        Parameters:
        username - Username of the user.
        Returns:
        Id of the user.

      • usernameExists

        public boolean usernameExists(java.lang.String username)
        This method calls the UserPersistUser to check if the given username exists in the database. Returns true if it does; false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        username - Username to check.
        Returns:
        True if username exists in the database; false otherwise.
